Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Panurgine K (PNG-K; UCSS1a; 2S=S, Lys-rich; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Disulfide bridges of the pattern Cys8-Cys23 and Cys11-Cys19. Substituting Cys by ?-amino butyric acid disrupted peptide activity, indicating the importance of disulfide bridges for the antimicrobial activity. It exhibited antimicrobial activity against Gram-positive bacteria and Gram-negative bacteria ( (M. luteus 1.6 uM; E. coli, 7.2 uM; p. aeruginosa 100 uM; B. subtilis 3.3 uM), ), antifungal activity (MIC C. albicans 24.2 uM), and low hemolytic activity against human erythrocytes (HL50 >200 uM). Updated 5/2017.
Literature Information.Author: Cujová S, Slaninová J, Monincová L, Fucík V, Bednárová L, Stokrová J, Hovorka O, Voburka Z, Straka J, Cerovský V.2013
Literature Information.Title: Panurgines, novel antimicrobial peptides from the venom of communal bee Panurgus calcaratus (Hymenoptera: Andrenidae).
